meanings.definition: A person who is timid or easily scared.
meanings.sent1: The little wuss was afraid of his own shadow.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a wuss, just face your fears!
meanings.sent3: The wuss screamed when a butterfly landed on his shoulder.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a wuss compared to her brave friends.
meanings.sent5: The wuss trembled at the sound of thunder.

meanings.definition: To act in a cowardly or timid manner.
meanings.sent1: He wussed out of the challenge at the last minute.
meanings.sent2: Don't wuss out now, you can do it!
meanings.sent3: She wussed out of trying the spicy food and regretted it later.
meanings.sent4: The team wussed their way through the difficult task.
meanings.sent5: He always wusses when it comes to making tough decisions.
